abstract: Chevron missed first-quarter profit and sales estimates as falling production blunted the impact of surging oil prices
snippet: Chevron missed first-quarter profit and sales estimates as falling production blunted the impact of surging oil prices
lead_paragraph: Chevron missed first-quarter profit and sales estimates as falling production blunted the impact of surging oil prices. Net income rose 4.2 percent to $6.47 billion, or $3.27 a share, from $6.21 billion, or $3.09 a share, a year earlier, the company said. Sales rose 0.8 percent to $58.9 billion, 7.8 percent lower than the average of three analysts’ estimates compiled by Bloomberg. Stock in Chevron, which is based in San Ramon, Calif., fell 2 cents, or 0.02 percent, to $106.20 a share.

headline.main: Chevron Misses Forecasts Despite Higher Oil Prices
headline.print_headline: Chevron Misses Forecasts Despite Higher Oil Prices
